title: Senior Quantitative Risk Analyst – Leveraged Loans & Fixed Income
description:
¡Ampliamos nuestro equipo!

¿Buscas un nuevo reto donde desarrollar tu carrera y aprender nuevas tecnologías? Entonces sigue leyendo porque esto te puede interesar.

Scalian es una empresa de más de 6.000 personas con una dimensión internacional, con oficinas en Europa y América del Norte. Estamos especializados en dar servicios a diferentes clientes enfocados en Data, Cloud e Inteligencia Artificial.

¿Qué buscamos?

Buscamos un/a Senior Quantitative Risk Analyst para integrarse en el equipo de profesionales de un importante cliente del sector bancario, en un proyecto centrado en modelos de riesgo de mercado para productos de renta fija y préstamos apalancados (leveraged loans) .

El entorno de trabajo es dinámico y técnico, con un enfoque en el desarrollo, validación y documentación de modelos financieros avanzados.

Requisitos mínimos:
• Título avanzado (Máster o PhD) en disciplinas cuantitativas:
Finanzas, Física, Matemáticas, Estadística, Ciencia de Datos, Informática o Finanzas Cuantitativas.
• Mínimo 3-5 años de experiencia en desarrollo y/o validación de modelos de riesgo de mercado en entidades financieras.
• Nivel fluido de Español e Ingles.
• Experiencia probada en pricing y modelización de riesgo para productos de trading de renta fija, especialmente préstamos apalancados.
• Conocimiento profundo de teoría de modelos, técnicas de calibración y modelos de tipos de interés unifactoriales como el modelo Hull-White .
• Programación avanzada en Python , con experiencia práctica en pruebas de modelos financieros.
• Experiencia con Numerix u otras plataformas de modelado financiero similares.
• Capacidad para diseñar y validar marcos de atribución de P&L (Profit & Loss).
• Dominio de conceptos de riesgo de mercado y estándares regulatorios como Value at Risk (VaR) , análisis de sensibilidad (Greeks) y validación de modelos conforme a la guía SR 11-7 .
• Sólida experiencia en la redacción de planes de prueba, documentación de desarrollo de modelos y guías de implementación.

¿Qué tendrás con nosotros?

¿Qué tendrás con nosotros?

25 días laborables de vacaciones

En el grupo apostamos por iniciativas sostenibles.

Despega en tu carrera con Scalian Spain

title: Quantitative Analyst
description:
Job Description

We are seeking a skilled Quantitative Risk Analyst to support the execution, monitoring, and analysis of credit risk models. The ideal candidate will have strong analytical skills and experience with data analysis, financial modeling, and regulatory compliance.
Key Responsibilities:
• Model Execution and Monitoring: Execute and monitor risk models to ensure they run correctly and provide accurate results.
• Analysis and Insights: Analyze model outputs to identify trends and potential issues.
• Data Preparation and Analysis: Assist in data preparation and analysis to support model development and improvements.
• Data Extraction and Insights: Work with large datasets using Python and SQL to extract insights.
• Managerial Support: Support the manager with various tasks related to quantitative modeling and regulatory requirements.
• Documentation: Help document models and findings for internal and regulatory use.
• Knowledge Development: Continuously learn and apply knowledge of PD, LGD, and EAD modeling, CECL/IFRS9, and stress testing frameworks.
Who We Are Looking For:
• Curious and Eager Learner: Curious and eager to learn, with an interest in financial risk and data analysis.
• Analytical Thinker: Analytical thinker who enjoys problem-solving.
• Hands-on and detail-oriented, comfortable working with numbers and large datasets.
• Effective Communicator: Good communicator, able to explain findings clearly.
• Team Player: Team player, willing to support the team in different tasks.
Required Skills:
• Degree in Quantitative Field: Degree in a quantitative field (Finance, Economics, Mathematics, Statistics, Data Science, Engineering, or similar).
• Prior Experience: Prior experience with PD, LGD, EAD models is highly preferred.
• Programming Skills: Extensive knowledge of Python and SQL for data analysis.
• Problem-Solving Skills: Strong problem-solving skills and ability to work with data, attention to detail, and ability to manage multiple tasks.

title: Loan Trading - Quantitative Analyst
description:
Loan Trading - Quantitative Profile

Location Remote - Madrid (GMT+1)

Skill and task to be completed
• Proven experience in pricing and risk modeling for fixed income trading products, with a focus on leveraged loans.
• Strong understanding of model theory, calibration techniques, and dynamics of one-factor interest rate models, including the Hull-White model.
• Advanced Python programming skills, with hands-on experience in testing financial models.
• Experience with Numerix or comparable vendor-based modeling systems.
• Proficient in designing and validating Profit and Loss (PnL) attribution frameworks.
• Deep knowledge of market risk concepts and regulatory standards, including Value at Risk (VaR) using historical simulation, model sensitivity analysis (Greeks), and model validation practices aligned with SR 11-7 guidelines.
• Demonstrated expertise in drafting detailed test plans, model development documentation, and implementation guides.
• Advanced degree (Master’s or Ph.D.) in a quantitative discipline such as Finance, Physics, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, or Quantitative Finance, with a strong background in modeling.
• Minimum of 3-5 years of experience in developing and/or validating trading book market risk models within the financial services industry.
• Required Language:
Spanish and English

title: Quantitative Finance Specialist
description:
Senior Quantitative Analyst Position
Join our team and embark on a challenging career path as a Senior Quantitative Analyst. As a key member of our team, you will be responsible for analyzing complex financial data, developing mathematical models, and optimizing algorithms to improve our financial forecasting and trading strategies.

About the Job
As a Senior Quantitative Analyst, you will work closely with our quantitative analysts, data scientists, and developers to understand requirements and deliver effective solutions. You will also collaborate with financial teams to understand domain-specific needs and translate them into code.

Key Responsibilities
- Develop mathematical models, simulations, and optimization algorithms for financial forecasting, market analysis, and trading strategies
- Optimize code for speed and scalability
- Ensure accuracy and integrity of data used in financial calculations

Required Skills and Qualifications
- Strong Python programming skills with experience in libraries such as NumPy, Pandas, SciPy, Matplotlib, and SymPy
- Solid understanding of quantitative finance, including financial modeling, asset pricing, risk management, and derivatives
- Experience working with complex financial instruments such as options, bonds, and equities
- In-depth knowledge of mathematics, particularly probability theory, stochastic processes, optimization, and time series analysis
- Expertise in handling large datasets, performing statistical analysis, and using SQL or NoSQL databases to retrieve and process financial data

Benefits and Opportunities
- Competitive salary and benefits package
- Opportunity to work on challenging projects and develop your skills
- Collaborative and dynamic work environment
- Professional growth and development opportunities

About Us
We are a global company that offers Software and Digital Engineering solutions. We hire professionals based solely on their skills and do not discriminate based on age, disability, religion, gender, sexual orientation, socioeconomic status, or nationality.

description:
Risk Analyst for Quantitative Modeling needed at HighPoint Ventures - San Luis Potosí, Mexico. Posted on 2025-06-02. Salary: 27380 Mexican Peso. Apply now for this exciting opportunity!
Join HighPoint Ventures as a Quantitative Risk Analyst in San Luis Potosí, Mexico. We seek candidates with skills in Knowledge of industry regulations and compliance standards for risk analysis and reporting, Expertise in financial and statistical modeling for risk assessment in various sectors, and Experience in working with cross-functional teams to mitigate risk and implement solutions, who are capable of performing Work with compliance teams to ensure all risk models meet regulatory standards, Review and evaluate risk management processes to recommend improvements in procedures, and Perform stress testing and scenario analysis to predict potential risk impacts. This opportunity is perfect for someone in Category. Enjoy Flexible employment and a salary of 27380 Mexican Peso. Send your resume to [application email] before 02/07. Be a key part of our success! Skills:

- Skilled in using data analysis tools, such as Excel, R, Python, and MATLAB
- Ability to identify and assess financial and operational risks using statistical models
- Expertise in financial and statistical modeling for risk assessment in various sectors
- Experience in working with cross-functional teams to mitigate risk and implement solutions
- Knowledge of industry regulations and compliance standards for risk analysis and reporting

Responsibilities:

- Perform stress testing and scenario analysis to predict potential risk impacts
- Review and evaluate risk management processes to recommend improvements in procedures
- Analyze large datasets using statistical tools to identify and quantify potential risks
- Work with compliance teams to ensure all risk models meet regulatory standards
- Monitor financial and market trends to adjust models and risk assessment methods accordingly

Alerts
- Skill in using real-life examples to enhance audience understanding of ideas.
- Strategic Thinking: Means creating long-term plans to achieve distant goals.
- Setting Goals for Each Project: And working efficiently to complete them in the best possible way.
- Team Leadership: Guiding and motivating team members to achieve shared goals.
- Continuous Improvement: Constantly seeks to improve work through evaluations and strategic decision-making.

Notes
- Don’t miss the chance to join an exceptional team.
- Employees receive comprehensive insurance and rewarding salaries to ensure a decent life.
- Working meticulously to achieve high quality in every aspect of tasks.
- Continuous collaboration with colleagues to achieve desired objectives.
- Take responsibility for work outcomes and ensure that defined goals are achieved.

title: Quantitative Analyst Intern
description:
Internship Description

This internship is designed for students interested in pursuing a career in actuarial science or a related field.

The intern will work closely with our team to generate models based on statistical information, evaluate financial projects, and assess risks.

Key responsibilities include:
• Statistical analysis of healthcare data
• Participation in health-related projects
• Risk assessment for consulting projects
• Creation of visual aids and reports

The ideal candidate will possess:
• A solid understanding of mathematical and statistical concepts
• Proficiency in data science tools such as R and Python
• Strong communication and collaboration skills

To apply, please ensure you meet the following requirements:
• Currently enrolled in a mathematics, statistics, or actuarial science program
• Demonstrate analytical and problem-solving skills
